basics.name: Daniel Manrique-Castano
basics.label: Neuroscientists / Data scientist
basics.summary: I am a neuroscientist focused on understanding glial reactivity following brain injury. To address these issues, I rely on image processing tools and statistical modeling using Python and R. I am an ardent advocate for open and reproducible science, and a dedcitaed educator in good research practices and research data managemen. Science communication and my recent foray into project management complement my skill set.

work.name: Univeristy Laval, Quebec, Canada
work.summary: Research on pericyte reactivity and brain remodeling following cerebral ischemia
highlights: Pericyte reactivity following ischeia, Point pattern analysis, Topological data analysis

work.name: Universidad San Buenaventura, Bogotá, Colombia
work.summary: Lecturer in the PhD program in Applied Neuroscience and Behavior. Research design, research data management, data analysis, scientific writing

work.name: Essen University Hospital, Essen, Germany
work.summary: Research on extracellular matrix, neuroglial and immune response in mouse model of cerebral ischemia
highlights: Neuroglial reactivity following ischeia, Extracellular matrix

publications.name: Topological remodeling of cortical perineuronal nets in focal cerebral ischemia and mild hypoperfusion
publications.summary: Here, we show that focal cerebral ischemia induces partial depletion of PNNs and that mild hypoperfusion not associated with ischemic injury can induce ultra-structural rearrangements in visually intact meshworks. In line with the activation of neural plasticity under mild stress stimuli, we provide evidence that topological conversion of PNNs can support post stroke neural rewiring.

publications.name: Unbiased quantification of the spatial distribution of murine cells using point pattern analysis
publications.summary: This protocol presents a stepwise approach to quantitatively describe the spatiotemporal changes in glial cell rearrangement in the injured murine brain

publications.name: Tenascin-C restricts reactive astrogliosis in the ischemic brain
publications.summary: We show that TnC plays a central role in restraining post-ischemic astrogliosis and regulating astrocyte-microglial interactions.

publications.name: Inhibitory control in neuronal networks relies on the extracellular matrix integrity
publications.summary: We show that the brain’s ECM preserves the balanced state of neuronal networks by supporting inhibitory control via inhibitory synapse stabilization, which expands the current understanding of brain activity regulation.

publications.name: Tenascin-C preserves microglia surveillance and restricts leukocyte and, more specifically, T-cell infiltration of the ischemic brain
publications.summary: In this artcile, we propose that the reduced microglia surveillance in TnC deficient mice favour leukocyte accumulation in the ischemic brain.
